body: @muraliramasami @deepakbarr @pavankumar526  I have addressed all the review comments. Modified  NativeInstanceUtil.waitTillInstancesAreCreated logic (as deepak suggested) and added documentation for the same. Please check once.
@watermen  We have now started to accept github based pull requests. Would you like to create a JIRA and update your pull request?
@watermen We have started to accept pull requests but we still use JIRA for issue tracking. Would you mind creating a JIRA and updating your pull request?
@kenneththo  I believe this is already committed, can you please close this pull request?
@Ankit-Jindal Do you mind closing this pull request?
@baishuo Do you mind closing this pull request?

@vramachan This is very useful and thanks for doing it. While I am migrating the existing code to lifecycle, I understand that we have to cater to user requests for new features also along with migration. However, this keeps adding more work on migration as well. I think it will help in the transition if we decide on a no more feature addition to existing import / export along with a timeline for completing the transition so that the new features additions don't have to wait too long either. Makes sense?
Looks good +1
:+1:  LGTM
Looks good +1  will merge this if there no further comments
Patch looks good. +1 .
Thanks @pavankumar526, @sandeepSamudrala, @peeyushb  for the review. Will merge shortly.
@muraliramasami @deepakbarr Please review. I want to commit this patch so that I can confirm native scheduler behaviour in my nightly regression.

@ajayyadava Agree with you. We need to address few crucial items (like this one that fixes working with HCatalog) before the next release. I think by next week, we can safely pause on adding new features until we have it converted to lifecycle. Lets sync up on the timelines for these on Tuesday.

There are checkstyle failures when I apply and build the patch.

Audit done.
Since FALCON-1838 will address export, +1 for the patch.

+1 Looks good
+1 for the patch, will commit shortly
@vramachan  : Please fix the possible nullpointer exception. Rest of the code looks good. I will commit once you make this fix and once we get another +1 from community
@vramachan If partitions are must and feed is validated during submit, I give +1 for this patch.

@vramachan Patch looks good. +1 .

thanks everyone for the review, will merge it shortly.
+1 for the patch. PrismFeedUpdateTest also depends on it. Just ensure that all tests are running fine.
Thanks @pragya-mittal . I have verified the test cases which depends on aggregatorNoOutput/workflow.xml and it passed which includes PrismFeedUpdateTest
+1 patch looks good to me and build passed without errors.
@yzheng-hortonworks +1. Patch looks good.
I will commit this patch if there no further review comments.
@vramachan You have a merge conflict with apache branch.

@ajayyadava  In response to your prior comment about migration to lifecycle: This import/export patch is committed and there are no further improvements planned for the next 2-3 weeks. Let me know if this is good enough for the Lifecycle migration. Should any urgent fix/improvement comes up, I will coordinate with you.
+1 Ying, will commit shortly

+1 
LGTM
+1. Thanks for updating the documentation.
+1 @vramachan patch looks good.
Should we undo archive if updateInternal fails?

@bvellanki  we are doing the same thing in delete also we first archive and then delete.In worst case we will have same copy which is currently running in production.
Test case of archive was missing on delete.I have added that too.

:+1:  Patch looks good.
As already mentioned by @ajayyadava , can you add a line on optional that, only fully available data would be considered for input.
@PraveenAdlakha Patch looks good. +1. Is it possible to add some documentation for this so that user should get inform that along with update of entity happen, archive of entity also occur.
+1 for the patch @PraveenAdlakha. But, as @peeyushb mentioned, updating the doc will be a good idea.
:+1:  @PraveenAdlakha : The next question that user would look for is, what does happen in subsequent updates?. Can you also add that its versioned(timestamp) archival.
@sandeepSamudrala  its already version when ever we archive we add timestamp to the files.
Thanks @sandeepSamudrala , @sriksun, @pavankumar526, @ajayyadava, thanks for the review. Will merge if no further comments.

@PraveenAdlakha  It is the general practice to give title of the pull request same as JIRA, this helps the committers while committing the patch and also ensures that the pull request titles are descriptive. Thanks for the pull request.
Thanks @PraveenAdlakha for adding the documentation. If no one has any further comments, I will commit this patch soon.
Build failure unrelated to patch.

@bvellanki Patch looks good. Can you add some documentation so that user must be aware of how to copy data, if TDE encryption is enabled.
Is the intention of the change to make fields (includes and excludes) optional or is it to remove the ability to specify the include/exclude fields? If it is latter, why are we doing it?

Directionally looks good. I had few comments.
Please rebase your patch.
+1 Looks good.
+1. Just one concern,Did you try building falcon regression by omitting -DskipCheck=true option ?
Thanks @PraveenAdlakha @pragya-mittal  for the review

@pragya-mittal  I have used the following command to build the regression which excludes "-DskipCheck" option. 
export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=1024m" && mvn clean install -DskipTests -Phadoop-2 -Ptest-patch
Thanks @pragya-mittal  for the review

+1 for the patch. Will commit shortly.

@peeyushb  : Since it is TDE, user does not have to do anything different to copy data during manual bootstrap steps.
Peeyush and @ajayyadava  : I added documentation in HiveDR.twiki on how to update recipe properties when TDE encryption is enabled.
@sowmyaramesh  please update the existing documentation..

I wanted to create two pull requestions on for removing client side and other for moving it to server side. Somehow everything in one pull request. I will fix that tomorrow. Sorry about that. Please continue review after In update the pull requests.

@PraveenAdlakha : I should have mentioned in the jira. Planning to update documentation as part of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FALCON-1106. Please ignore documentation errors in this pull request if any.
Closing this as I have created two separate pull requests https://github.com/apache/falcon/pull/91 and https://github.com/apache/falcon/pull/92.
